The name Giant is good because these dogs are 65 to 67.5 cm tall. All Schnauzers have long hair, which needs to be cut often. Most smaller Schnauzers are grey, but the Giant Schnauzer is usually black. Schnauzers come from Germany. Farmers use them to help with sheep, and the police use them because Schnauzers are very smart. A Schnauzer is a nice family dog. It is friendly and very good with young children.'

Text: 'The Ruwenzori Mountains Mary Daniels is a student in England. This year she had a very interesting summer holiday. She traveled with fifteen other people to the Ruwenzori Mountains in Africa. They went there to help make a road through a forest between two big towns. 'It was very difficult because there was no water to drink and no shops where we could buy food,' said Mary. 'It was also very cold and wet in the mountains. It is one of the wettest places in the world.' Mary stayed in the mountains for six weeks. It was hard work, but she says it was the best thing she has ever done. She hopes to go back next year to do more work there.'

Text: 'Dear Keira, Thank you for your letter. I had my first day at my new school today. A girl named Nicole helped me and showed me where the classrooms were. She is very nice, and I will visit her this weekend. My favorite lesson today was Maths, and I was happy because I knew more than the other girls. I also played hockey for the first time. I really liked it. Most of the teachers seem friendly, but I'm scared of the head teacher. No one likes him because he shouts a lot. I must go now because I have to do my homework. Hester'

New Books This Month

The Long Night  
This is David Reilly's first book. David was a teacher before he became a writer. Maha is a nurse in northern Australia. She works in a small hospital. One day, a baby is very sick. Maha has to drive all night to take the baby to the nearest big city. They have many problems on the way and ...

Hard Work  
This is Joanna Jones's twentieth book. Hard Work is about Sombat, who works with his father in Thailand. They make tables and chairs, but they do not have much money. One day, a man in black buys the most beautiful table in the shop ...

Hospital or Cinema?  
Marcie Jacome wrote this story earlier this year. She studies English in London. Tina is a young woman from Brazil. She wants to be a doctor. She goes to London to study English and medicine. One day, she meets a man who asks her to go to the USA to become a film star ... What will Tina do?

Text: 'The history of horse racing Horse racing has been an important sport for a long time. It started in Central Asia about 4,500 years ago. It was also popular in Greek and Roman times. Modern horse racing began when Arab horses came to Europe in the 12th century. At first, races were long and only had two horses. In the 18th century, races became shorter and had more horses. Today, many people watch horse racing in the USA, more than any other sport except baseball. It is also popular in other parts of the world.'

Text: Nick Barlow is a British actor. He loves his job because he travels around the world to make TV shows. 'People are friendly everywhere I go, and when I come home, I remember all the great things from each country,' he says. Nick has visited many places, but he still wants to go to South America and return to Australia one day. Nick travels with a team. They bring cameras and other things to make the show. Nick doesn't take many personal things, just a few shirts and trousers, but he always takes some books. Nick's wife, Helen, is okay with him traveling for work. She has many friends and stays busy. When Nick comes home, she enjoys hearing his travel stories. But sometimes there are problems. When Nick was in the Malaysian rainforest, he heard that Helen was sick in the hospital. 'I felt bad because I couldn't help, but she didn't want me to come home. I was very happy when I heard she was better,' he says.

Parrots

Maybe you have seen these beautiful birds with their bright colors and long tails in the forest or at the zoo. Parrots live in countries like Brazil, Australia, and India. They usually live in big groups. Parrots like to eat fruit, so sometimes they cause problems for farmers. There are many kinds of parrots, but all of them have strong beaks and feet. They use these for climbing and holding food. The biggest parrots can live for up to 80 years. They are very noisy, but they are smart birds, and you can teach them to talk easily. Some zoos have parrot shows where you can watch the birds do tricks they have learned.

Text: 'HOWARD BONNIER Bray is a pretty village about fifty kilometres west of London. A young Englishman named Howard Bonnier opened a restaurant called The Palace there about three and a half months ago. Not many people in Britain know Mr Bonnier's name yet, but he is already quite famous in France. This is because he has written in French magazines about almost all the best restaurants in that country. He is only 29 years old. When Howard was a teenager, he often went to restaurants with his mother and father. He liked doing this so much that he decided not to buy lots of clothes and CDs; instead, he used his money to visit France and eat in good restaurants. He also bought a lot of French and English cookbooks - he says he has more than two hundred and fifty! So why did he decide to open a restaurant? Simply because he loves cooking. Has it been an easy thing to do? He says it's expensive to start your own restaurant and it's much more difficult to cook for fifty people than to cook for your family, but he is sure he has done the right thing.'

Text: 'John Pickering In a park in a small town in central England, John Pickering cuts the grass and waters the flowers. But last week he was in Tokyo, and many Japanese people watched the thirty-five-year-old gardener on TV because John is the number one singer in Japan now. John went to Japan a few months ago to sing in dance clubs in Osaka and Nagoya. A disc jockey heard his songs and played them on his radio show. Many young people called the radio and asked to hear the songs again. John, who uses the name Jon Otis when he sings in Japan, will not stop working in the park in England. He does not know how much money he will make from his music. 'I must keep my job in the park,' he says. 'I still have to pay my bills!' The other gardeners do not know he is famous in Japan. They have never heard him sing. John's wife, Denise, who works in a hospital, says, 'This will not change the way we live. I only know John Pickering, not Jon Otis!''

Text: 'Memo To: All staff Subject: Holidays From: D Brown Date: 22.2.02 I am planning the holidays for next year. Please tell me when you want to take your holiday. If you can, give me two dates. Please tell me by the end of the month. Thank you. D Brown Memo To: D Brown Subject: Holidays From: J Green Date: 23.2.02 Can I take two weeks' holiday in July? I want the first two weeks, but if that is not possible, the last two weeks are OK. Also, can I take three extra days in the first week of December? John'

Text: 'Line dancing Many people in Britain have a new hobby -- line dancing. In almost every town, you can find clubs and classes for this activity. 'Line dancing is easy to learn. If you have two feet and can walk, then you can do it!' says Fiona Lever, a teacher. 'You don't need a partner because you dance in groups. It's a great way to make new friends. In my classes, there are young and old people. The boys like it because they can make a lot of noise with their feet during the dances!' When did line dancing start? Most people think it started about fifteen years ago when American country music became popular in Britain.'

Text: 'The Rhino There are five types of rhinos in the world today. The Black and White Rhinos live in the open fields of Africa. The other rhinos live in forests in Asia. All rhinos have big, heavy bodies. Their skin is very hard and they have very little hair. Rhinos have four short legs, and each foot has three toes. They usually walk very slowly, but they can run at 50 kilometres an hour. Rhinos are usually quiet and calm animals, and they only eat grass and other plants. A baby rhino weighs 40 kilos when it is born. It stays inside its mother for about fifteen months. An adult rhino weighs over 200 kilos and can live to be 50 years old.'

Text: 'THE HISTORY OF THE LONDON POLICE Today, there are policemen everywhere, but in 1700, London had no policemen. A few old men watched the city streets at night, and they did not get much money. About 300 years ago, London started to grow. The city was very dirty, and many people were poor. There were many thieves who took money in the streets, so people stayed in their homes a lot. In 1750, Henry Fielding began to pay some people to stop thieves. They were like policemen and were called 'Bow Street Runners' because they worked near Bow Street. Fifty years later, there were 120 Bow Street Runners, but London had become very big and needed more policemen. So, in 1829, the first Metropolitan (or London) Police Force started with 3000 officers. Most of the men walked, but a few rode horses. Until 1920, all the police in London were men. Today, London police are paid well, and for the few police officers who still ride horses, the pay is even better than for the others.'

Text: 'TO ALL STUDENTS: Do you want to come on a camping trip this weekend? We will go to the forest in the school bus and stay at a camp-site from Friday to Sunday. The camp-site has hot showers and a small shop. You can also rent bicycles there. The trip costs £25. It is very cold at night, so you should bring warm clothes and wear strong shoes. If you want to come, tell me today. Ahmed, Student Secretary'

Text: 'Visit the Edinburgh Festival! Every year, many people come to Edinburgh, the capital city of Scotland, to enjoy the Edinburgh Festival. For three weeks every August and September, the city is full of actors and artists from all over the world. They come for the biggest arts festival in Britain. During this time, the streets are busy with music and dance from early morning until late at night. You can even see artists painting on the streets. One of the best parts of the Festival is the 'Fringe', where students do comedy shows in small halls and cafes. Many tourists come to the Festival to see new films and plays and hear music by famous musicians. This year, you can see over five hundred performances with actors from more than forty countries. The tickets for these shows are not very expensive, and it is usually easier to see your favourite star in Edinburgh than in London. So come to Edinburgh next summer, but remember it can be hard to find a room, so why not book your hotel now!'
{'index': -9, 'text': 'None'}

Text: 'From: Greg To: Anna Hi Anna, I'm not having a good week! Yesterday my team played a volleyball match, but we lost. The other team played better than us! Then my friend Jeff, who lives in Australia, called with bad news. He can't come to stay with us during the holidays because he has a summer job. We can't go camping together now. And this morning, my sister got up late, so she took my bike to school! She didn't tell me she needed it. I'm really angry with her. I hope you have some good news! Write back today if you can. Greg '

Text: 'Madame Tussaud's A very famous place for tourists in London is Madame Tussaud's museum. Here, people can see figures of famous people made of wax. Madame Tussaud was born in France in 1761. Her uncle was a doctor who made wax figures of people. He opened a museum of these figures in Paris. Marie helped him with his work. In 1789, during the French Revolution, Marie went to prison. There, she had to make copies of the heads of famous people after they died, including Queen Marie Antoinette. In 1795, Marie married Francois Tussaud. In 1802, she came to London with her wax figures. She opened a museum there, and her figures can still be seen today.'

Text: 'BICYCLES The bicycle is a cheap and clean way to travel. The first bicycle was made about 150 years ago. At first, bicycles were expensive. Only rich people could buy one. These early bicycles looked very different from the ones we have today. Later, when bicycles became cheaper, many people bought one. People started riding bicycles to work and in their free time. Today, people use cars more than bicycles because cars are much faster and you don't get wet when it rains! But some people still like to cycle to work. They say there are too many cars in town centers and you can't find anywhere to park!'

Text: 'The Elephant Show by Daniel Allsop, age 14 Last summer, I went to Thailand for a beach holiday with my family. One day, we visited a park near our hotel. It had beautiful flower gardens, but we wanted to see the elephant show. We went to a big square with seats on three sides. Three elephants came in with their keepers and stood in front of a big white card. Each elephant got a paintbrush and started to paint on its own card. Sometimes, the keepers gave the elephants a new brush with paint and took the old one away. Slowly, the elephants drew pictures on the cards, following their keepers' instructions. I couldn't believe it! One picture showed a river, one a tree, and the third a bunch of flowers. When the keepers showed the paintings, everyone wanted to buy one. We gave the elephants the bananas we brought for our lunch. Twenty years ago, elephants worked in the forest. Now, they do not work there, but the smartest elephants live in special places where visitors can watch them.'

Text: 'Big cats There are many different kinds of big cats. They are different in size and they do not look or act the same. Tigers are the biggest cats. From head to tail, they can be 3.7 meters long. Most cats don't like water, but tigers often lie in water when it is hot! Lions are the only cats that live in big family groups. Several lions work together to get food for the group. They usually live in flat, open areas where they can see far and follow other animals easily. All cats need good eyes because they catch smaller animals for food. They also need to be fast and very strong.'

Text: 'Dear Mrs. Brian, I am sorry, but I can't come to your class anymore because I have to go back to my country. My sister will get married next month. I want to go shopping with her to choose a dress. My parents will make a big meal for the guests, and there will be a lot of work in the kitchen. I'm sorry I have to leave the English class. You are a very good teacher. Please say goodbye to the other students for me. Thank you again. Best wishes, Soraya'

Text: '14 Sheffield Road Rotherham 20th May 2002 Dear Mary, I will be in London next Thursday morning. Would you like to have lunch with me? Please write and tell me when you are free and where I can meet you. Hope to see you then. Yours, Joan 20 Didsbury Drive London NW1 22 May 2002 Dear Joan, Thank you for your letter. I got it this morning. Yes, I would love to see you. How about meeting outside my office at one o'clock? There is a good Italian restaurant near there. Do you like Italian food? I have to be back at work by two o'clock, so please don't be late! Yours, Mary '

Text: 'Dear Lorna, How are you? I'm happy because last month I got a new job in the city centre. I work in a Tourist Information Office, and it is very interesting. I start work every morning at 7:30, so I have to get up very early! I love this job because I meet people from many different countries. I like telling them about our city. Here is a photo of me. I'm wearing my new uniform. Do you like it? Love, Gloria '

Text: 'THE OSTRICH The ostrich is the biggest bird in the world. An adult ostrich can weigh more than 90 kilos. Most wild ostriches live in southern Africa, but there are not many left. Ostriches have wings, but they cannot fly. They use their wings to help them turn when running. Ostriches can run very fast, from 65 to 90 kilometres an hour, so it is hard for other animals to catch them. Baby ostriches are the same size as chickens and take about 3 years to grow up. Ostriches eat plants and can live for many days without water.'

Victoria Jamieson is from Britain. She started snowboarding when she was 20 years old. Now, she is 23 and has won many snowboarding competitions. We talked to her last week at a competition in Switzerland. We asked her why she started snowboarding. She said, "I have always liked sports, especially skiing, so snowboarding was a natural choice. It is easy to learn, and you can become good in a few months."

We asked if she practices a lot. She said, "In winter, I snowboard in the mountains every day from 8:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. I also run and bike. I love doing all of it! I enjoy the competitions and being in the mountains. It's so beautiful. But free-riding, which is snowboarding for fun and not in a competition, is the best for me."

We asked her what is important when learning snowboarding. She said, "You can learn quickly, but you need lessons. It's also important to have the right clothes so you don't get wet because, at first, you fall down a lot!"

Text: '23 Oak Avenue Manchester Dear Sir or Madam, I want a room at your hotel for three nights from September 15th to 17th. I would like a single room with a shower. I also need a telephone in my room. Can I have a quiet room on the ground floor, please? I will drive to the hotel. Is there a car park at the hotel? I will arrive at about 10.30 p.m. What time does the restaurant close in the evening? If possible, I would like to have a meal when I arrive. Thank you for your help. Yours sincerely, Mark Jones'

Text: 'Mount Kilimanjaro Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa. Many people have climbed Kilimanjaro, from a seven-year-old boy to an 87-year-old man. There are different paths to the top. People think that the five-kilometre Marangu path is the easiest. It takes about five days and is very popular with tourists. Only half of the climbers who try to climb Kilimanjaro reach the top. This is often because the weather can change quickly. At the start, it can be hot and wet, but when climbers get to the top, they find ice and snow, and the temperature can be below 20 degrees. Climbers need to bring both sunglasses and warm clothes!'

Text: 'Otters Not many people have seen an otter. These animals live near rivers and make their homes from small pieces of wood. They usually come out of their homes at night. Otters are very good in the water and can swim faster than 10 kilometres an hour. They have thick brown hair that keeps them warm in the water. An otter can close its ears and nose, so it can stay under water for a few minutes. Twenty years ago, there were not many otters in Great Britain. The water in the rivers was very dirty, so many fish and insects died, and the otters couldn't find food. But today there is a lot of food for them because the rivers are clean again.'

Text: 'Dear Deshini, I'm happy you are my new penfriend. My name is Tom and I am fifteen years old. I was born in Canada, but now I live in England. Please write and tell me about your life in India. I would like to visit there one day. Do you live in a small village or a big town? What is your school like? Do you have any pictures of your school you can send me? I'm sending you some photos of my family. I'll send more next time I write. I hope you write to me soon. Tom'

Text: '17 Green Street Camden London 29th August 2002 Dear John, Thank you for helping me with my English. You are a very good teacher. I liked my time in Cambridge. Now I am at my brother's flat. He is learning to be a doctor. I will stay with him for two weeks and then go home to Greece. I like London a lot. We went to Regents Park by bus yesterday. It was very sunny and we had a good time. Tonight, I am going to see a film with my brother and some of his friends. I'll write again from Greece. Best wishes, Kostas'

Text: 'Dear David, I will visit your country next month. I will travel with two friends. We don't know where to stay. Are there any cheap hotels in your town? We want to stay in the centre. Can you help us? Carlos Dear Carlos, Hotels in the centre are expensive, but I have good news. I talked to my aunt Gloria about you, and she says you can all stay at her house. It has more bedrooms than my house! Is that okay with you? David'

Text: 'Buildings People have always made buildings. We need houses to keep us warm and dry. We build stadiums to watch football games and concerts. We use other buildings, like museums, to keep beautiful things. Many people work together on a building. The architect decides how the building will look and draws pictures of the ideas. Engineers make sure the building will be strong and safe. Then, the workers build it carefully. The Sydney Opera House is a famous modern building with a nice roof. The building is beautiful from every side, not just the top. There is also a famous roof on the Olympic Stadium in Munich. This building looks like a tent made of glass.'

Text: 'Indre, I have a problem and I need your help. Can you come shopping with me tomorrow? My grandmother will be 80 next month and she is having a party on Saturday. The problem is I don't have anything to wear. I have grown a lot, and all my trousers are too short now! I want to buy some new ones and maybe a pair of boots. I don't have a lot of money, but I think it will be enough. Would you like to meet me in the morning or the afternoon? Let me know. Sarika'

Text: 'The Cerne Giant Sherborne and Dorchester are two towns in the south of England that are close to each other. On the road between them, there are many green hills and fields. On one of these hills, there is a picture of a very big man. This man is called the Cerne Giant because the village next to him is called Cerne. Nobody really knows when the Cerne Giant was made, but people think it was a very long time ago. You can walk from Cerne to get closer to the picture. If you go on the first of May when the sun rises, you will see all the people from the village dancing around the man on the hill.'

Text: 'Gail Rollins Gail Rollins is a very good runner from Edinburgh. This summer, she wants to run the 10,000 meters and maybe the 5,000 meters at the European Championships. Before, Gail was famous for coming second in big races. But she always laughed and smiled, and people in her city love her for this. Everything changed in 2004 when she ran her first half-marathon, a very long road race. She won with the fastest time of the year for any British woman. Gail's manager and husband, Mike Rollins, also ran when he was younger, but he stopped because he hurt his right leg. He can still run a little and sometimes runs with Gail. But it's not fun for Mike when Gail runs faster than him. Gail trains hard. She runs a long distance in the morning and fast runs in the afternoon. But she always rests from running on Sundays. 'I am with her all the time,' says Mike. 'Sometimes I say, "Are you sure you should eat that?" It's usually cakes, but she can eat almost everything.' '

Text: 'Piano players - when they were young Ivan Petrov Ivan was born on a farm in Russia. From age twelve to eighteen, he studied in Poland. His first music teacher couldn't play the piano but taught him and his sister opera songs. His mother started teaching him piano when he was six. At ten, he wanted to write music and soon started his first song. Oleg Gagarin Oleg was the youngest of five children. When he was four, his father, who liked playing the piano, taught him some traditional Russian music. At six, he started piano lessons with a teacher in his city. Oleg soon won prizes for playing the piano. At fourteen, he went to a music college in Austria for two years. Later, he returned to Russia. Josef Heptmann Josef's father was German but taught music in Poland where Josef was born. The family moved to Germany when Josef was two. A year later, he started playing the piano. He gave his first concert at six. At ten, he gave fifty-two concerts in two months in England! Josef always liked music but was also interested in physics and languages. He is too busy now but wants to write his own music one day.'

Text: 'POSTCARDS Today, people like to send postcards to their friends and family. These postcards often have pictures of beaches, mountains, or castles on them. You can write a message on the back. Many people send postcards when they are on holiday because postcards are cheap. The pictures on them are often better than people's own photos. Someone sent the first postcard at the end of the 1800s. It had a picture of a town by the sea. Later, postcards had pictures showing something in the news that week, like an accident or an important person's visit. People liked to see them because they did not have pictures in their newspapers then.'

Text: 'Dinosaurs No one has ever seen a dinosaur. The last dinosaur died about 60 million years ago, a long time before people lived on Earth. Nobody knows for sure why they all died. The closest living relatives of dinosaurs are birds. Dinosaurs did not all look the same. There were more than 5000 kinds. Some were very small, but others were very big. The biggest were larger than any other animals that lived on land. The Brontosaurus, for example, was twenty meters long, and it ate plants. The Tyrannosaurus Rex was not as big, but it was stronger. It had sharp teeth for eating meat. Also, it could run fast because it had long back legs.'

Text: 'BEARS Bears can be dangerous animals. Adult bears are very strong and can kill a person. Bears are good at climbing trees and can run very fast. But they cannot see well. Like most animals, they find food by using their noses. There are seven kinds of bears. The largest is the white polar bear, which is almost three meters tall. There are two kinds of black bears. One lives in the forests of North America, and the other lives in South-East Asia. But not all black bears are black. They can be dark brown or reddish brown. Everyone loves the black and white panda bear, which comes from China. Not many pandas live in the forest today because it is hard to find food.'

CROCODILES

We can find crocodiles in warm parts of the world, like Africa, South America, and Northern Australia. They spend most of their time in slow-moving water, but they can move fast in water and on land. You often see crocodiles together in big groups. They eat everything they catch, like fish, birds, and small animals. Sometimes, they eat big animals or even people. There are more than ten types of crocodiles. They all have very sharp teeth. They often lose these teeth, but they grow new ones quickly. Crocodiles are usually about 3.5 meters long, but some are much bigger. Crocodiles live for a long time. The oldest one in a zoo was 66 years old.

Text: 'A HISTORY OF AIR TRAVEL In 1783, two French brothers made the first balloon to carry people into the air. One hundred and twenty years later, in 1903, the Wright brothers made the first plane with an engine and flew it. This happened in the United States. Then, in 1918, the US Post Office started the first airmail service. Aeroplanes changed a lot in the next thirty years. In the 1950s, aeroplanes became much faster because they had jet engines. In 1976, Concorde was made in the UK and France. It is the fastest passenger plane in the world and can fly at 2500 kilometres an hour, so the trip from London to New York is only four hours. Today, millions of people travel by aeroplane, and it is hard to think of a world without them.'

Text: 'The Globe Theatre Visiting the theatre in London 400 years ago was very different from today. The building was round and had no roof, so people got cold and wet if it rained. The queen liked going to the Globe Theatre by the River Thames to watch plays by William Shakespeare. All the actors were men. Visitors ate, talked to friends, walked around during the show, and some even threw things at the actors! Today, you can still visit the Globe Theatre. A new theatre is in the same place near the river. You can watch a Shakespeare play there or learn about life in the 1600s.'

Text: 'Dear Jeff, I'm having a good holiday in Australia. When we arrived two weeks ago, the weather was bad and it was cold. Now the weather is better, and we go to the beach every day. This week we are staying in Sydney, but next week we will go to the Great Barrier Reef. The water is warm, and I love swimming there. The fish are all different here: red, yellow, purple! Australia is very beautiful. We don't want to come home! See you at the end of September. Sue'
